INVENTORY AND VALUATION
(1) The inventory and valuation of the deceased person's property shall be carried out after the decision of the probate court and only when requested by the guardian, or in the event of a limitation of inheritance in accordance with Article 128 of this Act, or for other justifiable reasons.
(2) The court shall also order an inventory and valuation when this is requested by the deceased's heirs, legatees or creditors.
(3) An inventory and valuation shall also be carried out without a court decision thereon at the time of drawing up the coroner's certificate when an heir or legatee so requests.
